<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Organizes office administration, in support of an assigned professional or manager team.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. WFS is part of the Global Sales &amp; Marketing Organization reporting directly to the CEO of the Onshore Business Unit. The primary target of WFS is to ensure the exclusive wind turbine delivery by SGRE via such project development activity and to generate additional revenue streams. The Project Development Assistant will work closely with the Global Head of Wind Farm Solutions but also with the entire team to provide the required support in project development as well as operating wind farm management activities. As part of the role, you will also:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> processing Purchase Requisitions (PRs), invoices and conduct necessary vendor management related to development projects and operating wind farms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> manage the virtual data room (VDR) including information related to all projects being in the portfolio of WFS<\u002Fli>\n  <li> draft power points related to internal\u002F ext. meetings and topics of the department<\u002Fli>\n  <li> draft letters to authorities and customers in alignment with the WFS team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> internally coordinate the management and administration of special purpose vehicles (SPVs) and conduct with internal stakeholders (shareholder governance, tax, accounting) required alignments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> be in charge of calendars as well as scheduling, coordinating and arranging internal\u002Fexternal appointments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> mainly support the WFS team in day-to-day administrative topics and ad hoc tasks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> coordinate and prepare travel arrangements and you will also plan, book and settle travel expenses.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> lead administrative tasks derived from the day-to-day work in the department and support the employee on- and off-boarding, introductions etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> create and execute purchase orders, including IT equipment and handle the invoicing workflows.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> assist your assigned colleagues with travel cost reimbursements in case of questions; check travel expense with focus on cost saving.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> be in contact with customers, employees, external partners, management and other internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a Project Development Professional who will support in a Global Business Unit organization, called Wind Farm Solutions (WFS), the regions in the generation of strategic project development partnerships with stakeholders such as utilities, developers, IPPs, funds, etc. WFS is part of the Global Sales &amp; Marketing Organization reporting directly to the CEO of the Onshore Business Unit. The primary target of WFS is to ensure the exclusive wind turbine delivery by SGRE via such project development activity and to generate additional revenue streams.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Project Development Manager will work closely with the Project Development Manager as well as with the sales responsible in the regional organizations. Additionally, the candidate will support at BU level the consolidation of the project pipeline and budget deployed in development activities worldwide. As part of the role, you will also:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide support in structuring strategic partnerships with developers and investors on global level to maximize project value and ensure SGRE exclusivity<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Screen opportunities and initial assessment of identified opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in the definition of commercial agreements to participate in third party opportunities (co-investment, bid bonds, acquisition) presented by the different regions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support project due diligence and assist\u002Fsupport with negotiation of joint development agreements, shareholder agreements, share purchase agreements and similar investment agreements (e.g. Development Support Agreements)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supervise, support or lead (as relevant) project-related contract negotiations such as PPAs, BOP contracts, land leases and grid interconnection agreements as well as financing of the projects (in collaboration with internal\u002F external stakeholders supporting the process)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare and manage internal approval process for transaction on global level with the support of the regional sales manager and Transactions Department (e.g. SGRE SBA PM017)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide inputs and support project development timetables and budgets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate multidisciplinary teams\u002Fconsultants (financial, technical, legal), both external and internal<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate for a successful delivery of onshore wind project origination targets, brownfield\u002Facquisition project development or co-development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follow up the progress of co-development or co-investments and support department manager to attend JVs governance bodies and propose decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure routine focus on project quality, progression, budgeting, internal tracking, for all development projects throughout their lifetime and selling process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Elaborate quarterly reports showing WFS activity worldwide including contribution to order entry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Track and update in the internal sales IT system (One CRM) all SGRE projects under development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Receive, filter, register and tune all the requests for financial and technical assistance sent by the Sales &amp; Marketing department in the regions and present them in the Filtering Committee as well as managing committee agenda.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gather project information and support the regions in the preparation of presentations of opportunities to Pitching Committee<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote and foster a strong entrepreneurial and performance culture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Location for the role can be discussed (not necessarily Germany or Spain)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li> Support the direction of integrated project development teams, including CFO, Engineering, Legal, etc. functions.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense of the importance to lead the change. clarifies issues.<br> <br> What you need to make a difference<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> You are an engineer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have excellent communication skills of English (C1)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience in quality and production process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience in the application of problem solving tools: 8D Methodology, Kaizen, control plan, FMEA, SPC<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 3-5 years of work experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are an organized person<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Teamwork<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> In return of your commitment, we offer you…<br> \n   <ul>\n    <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n    <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <br> Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. <div>\n   Las principales responsabilidades del puesto son:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Puesta en marcha de inversores fotovoltaicos en plantas solares localizadas en destinos nacionales e internacionales.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Realizar las pruebas funcionales de los equipos en fábrica siguiendo los protocolos de ensayo y estándares de la compañía.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Realizar las pruebas de cliente.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Colaborar con Ingeniería en pruebas de validación de componentes y equipos, en la puesta en marcha y en análisis de incidencias.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dar soporte a los clientes reportar en tiempo y forma.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capacidad de liderazgo<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trabajo orientado a resultados y cumplimiento de planificación.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> For our Onshore project execution department, we are looking for a Contract Implementation Manager with a flavor for financials. Our department is financially responsible for the project execution of all projects within the South of Europe and Africa region and support this with a focus on planning, managing and reporting of the project as well as contract and claim management.\n <br> \n <br> We are building up competencies in our department with skilled personnel which have the ability to work as an internal legal advisor to the financial team by providing insight from a legal point of view, by analyzing and interpreting contract and claim situations, by assessing the financial impact of such situations to our business and by performing hands on activities to write legal statements, notices and claim documentation.\n <br> \n <br> You should apply for this job if you want to be working with big Wind Power projects in a business organization while having an impact on how we as a company will achieve better results. The job requires the ability to thrive in a hanging environment while keeping the necessary structure in your field of work.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Contract Implementation Manager, you will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Act as a consultant to the Financial Project Manager and other team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Assist in regard to managing of the contractual relationship between the contract parties and in resolving contractual issues in a proactive manner before and\u002For when they occur.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyze the contract to raise awareness of notification requirements and to allow the responsible team members to efficiently coordinate interfaces.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Monitor the execution of the contract with the aim of identifying risks and opportunities for potential claims.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform Contract and Claim Strategy Workshops.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare, update and coordinate the claim strategy for each project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare, collect, document and coordinate the sent out of all documents related to a certain claim.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supporting the Project Team in notifying, assessing, asserting\u002Fdefending, negotiating and monitoring identified claims e.g. by preparing notifications and claim letters.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supporting the legal department in case of Dispute Resolution and arbitration \u002F We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Service Digital E2E product, we are looking for a skilled and dedicated UI\u002FUX Designer for the Pixel Lovers Team to collaborate with product managementin the definition and implementation of innovative solutions for our Dojo Portal central data system.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The team is a part of the bigger software department with colleagues in Denmark, Hamburg, Spain (Bilbao, Pamplona, San Sebastian and Madrid) and India.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your tasks and deliverables are mainly providing designs based in our own Design System (the Dojo MDS) for the Dojo portal and support other teams in their development on Dojo Portal following agile methodologies.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate holds an academic degree in UX or similar in combination with passion about UX\u002FUI, aptitude to adapt legacy design in a modern way, and a thorough practical experience (at least recommended 3 – 5 years) with:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in high fidelity designs in Figma.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in prototypes\u002Fwireframes creation, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas for workshops and envision sessions with our stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in interaction design and information architecture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in Responsive design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in preparation\u002Fexecution\u002Fsummarizing different UX workshop types to help product management teams in their product roadmap definition<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in creating or management of complex Design Systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in solving complex problems in a simple way.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Facilitates the team’s progress toward team goals and supports the Product Owner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High professional competency and desire to develop.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good collaboration skills in different cultural contexts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong result and customer-oriented approach.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High level of English. Spoken and written. We are a worldwide operating company, and you will interact with international people and projects.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will be responsible to manage one or several major construction projects for SGRE: new wind turbine blade or nacelle factories, and\u002For extension of an existing facility.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will proactively manage and be accountable for the project execution in accordance with timeline, costs, risks, safety and quality.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will manage the pre-construction activities of the project: scope definition, project setup and strategy, design, permitting, tendering ; as well as supervise the construction phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will hire and manage the activities of several subcontractors: designer, project management company, built-to-suit developer.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will establish and manage interfaces with cross-functional and international teams within Siemens Gamesa, e.g.: Operations (industrial) teams, HSE, IT, Security, Legal, Procurement.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will lead the interface towards the land owner or lessor, and local authorities for all permitting and construction topics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will prepare and present regular reporting to SGRE management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will contribute to grow the technical knowledge of the team you belong to, by owning several expertise topics. You will contribute to regular lessons learnt and experience sharing.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You have a university degree in construction engineering, civil engineering, architecture or similar.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have 7 to 10 years of work experience in the context of construction projects of industrial or commercial facilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are structured, target-driven, and work solution-oriented and problem-solving manner, in order to deliver projects on time, quality and budget.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are very fluent (verbally and written) in English, e.g. able to negotiate and review contacts in English. Another language (Portuguese, is a plus).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are used to work in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Project).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You show great leadership, strong communication and cooperation skills in a complex and diverse project environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are able to convince, negotiate, motivate and steer project teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience from working in international and multicultural corporate environments<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. Cybersecurity Operations Professional will lead a team taking care of the vulnerabilities at Siemens Gamesa<\u002Fli>\n   <li>The Cybersecurity Operations professional will be responsible of the Gamesa<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drives to execution the defined remediation plans.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Engages with IT and business partners to ensure Vulnerabilities are understood and remediation plans implemented.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prepares the Dashboards to track the evolution of each the agreed remediation plans.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prepares Vulnerability Management reports to the Siemens Gamesa IT Cybersecurity department and partners when required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure effective communication and coordination of Siemens Gamesa IT and Siemens Gamesa IT contractors to achieve IT Cybersecurity Operations vulnerability management objectives<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Leads and implements Siemens Gamesa IT Cybersecurity Operations vulnerability management strategy plans based on sound IT Cybersecurity Operations Standards and vulnerability management processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensures effective communication with Siemens Gamesa Cybersecurity teams to partner in the cybersecurity initiatives and provide the Vulnerability Management point of view.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provides technical detailed explanations either in the vulnerability or the remediation actions to IT or the business.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitors within threat intelligence Team and sources applicable vulnerabilities to Siemens Gamesa to take necessary actions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensures the IT Cybersecurity Operations Vulnerability management capabilities: people, processes and technologies are operating effectively.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Reports to the Cybersecurity IT Manager and ultimately <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Realizes the functional concept of systems and components in projects for reversed engineering solutions.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Are you ready for high level problem solving and decision making, in a fast and dynamic service business?\n  <br> Do you strive with the empowerment and responsibility that comes with an independent role?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Then we are pleased to let you know, that we are looking for an Engineer with such character in our Electrical System Team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In the Electrical Service Unit we are 60 dedicated engineers from 11 different nationalities - all with the common goal of providing effective and responsive service solutions to a continuously evolving renewable market.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Through years of experience you have gained a broad technical knowledge on electrical systems and requirements, which are needed to support a reflective and independent analysis of failure modes - both electrical and mechanical (technical examples such as communication, Converters, EMC, motors &amp; drives etc.).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will provide technical support to the business unit through technical feedback, both written and verbally - reporting, statements and meetings. It will require you to collaborate cross functional with various business units, etc. procurement, product development and maintenance strategy.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   With our regional engineering you will define containment solutions and instructions for complex troubleshooting to ensure accurate documentation of failures and issues.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Further in a close collaboration with our R&amp;D and Product Owners, you will be leading the solutions development in projects of design modification on various components (e.g. product design, spare parts, tools and documentation) – some of which will resolve warranty matters with suppliers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your desire to learn and experience new challenges will encourage you to share knowledge and experience across our business unit.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You should be experienced in documenting your work in a structured and understandable way (e.g. 8D methodology). It is important both for the business unit and you in order to learn and develop – hence it is a necessity that you, both verbal and written can express yourself comfortably in English when documenting your work and delivering feedback (e.g. reporting, engineering statements and meetings).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Having experience within our organization or close competitors in the Wind turbine business is needed.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As part of a global team at least 30 travel days a year should be expected.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team j diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. You will become part of a high-performance team responsible for the converter control design for the renewable energy market.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Reviews relevant requirements, standards, and other documentation to clarify and understand converter control requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Models and simulates DFIG wind turbine converter and generator.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Models and simulates power converters for solar, battery storage and other renewable related applications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Designs, modifies and improves the control loops and algorithms.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Analyses customizations to local requirements and designs\u002Fadapts products and solutions accordingly.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Presents technical findings and developments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Writes detailed specifications and design documents of all the converter control algorithms.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participates in converter validation to ensure compliance with the design requirements in cooperation with the whole converter design team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Adheres to the quality process through the execution of test procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Cooperates with other engineering teams to support product testing and certifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Cooperates with other teams in the company to support presales, commissioning, aftersales, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>This position may require travel to customer and non-customer sites (20%)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>This position requires presential participation on validation processes on Madrid testbenches<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Skills and experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Implements and optimizes technological concepts concerning systems and \u002F or solutions.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Develops technological concepts as input for system and solution development.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Monitors system performance in the prototyping, test and verification phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Supports the commissioning phase with the customers, and analyzes potential malfunctions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Identifies and defines technical requirements for realizing alternative applications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Evaluates different build in concepts, with respect to technological and commercial aspects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensures observance of specifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Creates respective reports.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for an open-minded person with sound Engineering skills in Electrical Design based on an educational background as Electrical Engineer, Master of Technology\u002FScience, or similar. You like simulating complex systems. Knowledge of Grounding, Electromagnetic Compatibility or Lightning is an advantage and standards such IEC61000-6-4 &amp; IEC 61000-6-2 and IEC 61400-40. You are systematic in your approach to the work and results oriented, being able to handle several tasks at the same time and communicate with different stakeholders from different design groups, prototype build etc. You are committed to your tasks and able to drive them through to completion. In our global environment we expect you to possess strong communication skills and excellent English skills orally and in writing.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. The department is responsible, among other tasks, of collecting and providing clear, reliable and traceable relevant information about sales activity\u002Fperformance and competitive intelligence within Service business unit to relevant stakeholders.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will complete market analyses of profitability, market pricing, and trends and relevant reports, for Service Business Unit and assigned product (groups).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This position offers a unique opportunity of engaging a large and international organization, where you get the chance to influence your own fields of work and create a large network with colleagues and business partners worldwide. Conduct scope\u002Fprice\u002Fprofitability gap analysis on relevant deals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> will monitor competitors’ value propositions, performance, market share and relevant behaviours.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> will conduct market analysis to detect relevant trends and insights: price evolution, value propositions…<\u002Fli>\n  <li> will generate relevant insights for the organization to make well informed decisions to maximize value capture, including pricing recommendations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a person that...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree in Engineering, Marketing or related Business Studies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Min 3 years of relevant experience from similar function.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience from Global company, preferably also a matrix organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Industry (i.e. Renewables) and B2B experience a plus.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communicator and facilitator. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Reporting to Validation Outsourcing Manager, mission is to build a comprehensive overview of the electrical system test scopes requested across the different projects in product development and technology development.\n <br> \n <br> Plans, prepares and coordinates electrical system test campaigns according to the company Test Project model standards, throughout all stages of SGRE PLM Q-gate process.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Develop a comprehensive test plan, with the inputs provided by the electrical design module, to accommodate all level test need, from component to final system integration.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Deploy and follow up test plan with the test engineers in the team, with a close control on schedule, budget, and risks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide technical guidance in the test design phase.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support test engineers in the team in the test campaign preparation (material procurement, data acquisition architecture, logistics)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support test engineers in the coordination of teams and contractors to prepare and execute the test campaigns (assembly, instrumentation, inspection, operation, maintenance)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that all concurrent activities associated to a certain test have been assessed from the Health and Safety and Environmental points of view. Manage that the execution of these activities is done in compliance with the HSE Control Plan develop on the basis of the test campaign HSE Risk Assessment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor the test campaigns carried out by external test facilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review test results with solution owners and approve test report documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Act as single focal point for the We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. You will be based in our office in Pamplona, Spain.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our Measurement Technology Group consist of app. 20 people placed in Denmark, Spain, India and Romania, we have both full-time software developers and measurement technology experts within sensor technology, fiber optics system, lidars, acoustics, vibrations etc.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our software design team develop and maintain big Measurement Systems for especially prototype turbines and test rigs.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are working on all levels in capturing, transporting and storing of measurement data, but are also developing tools for exploring and exporting data.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We have three main groups.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Frontend systems (the Measurement systems that capture and generate data)\n   <ul>\n    <li> C#, TwinCat, Modbus, GPS\u002FPTP\u002FNTP (robustness, high accuracy, precise timestamping)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Backend systems for data transport and handling.\n   <ul>\n    <li> JAVA, RabbitMQ, WildFly (uptime, speed,<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Data management\u002Fdevelopment\n   <ul>\n    <li> SQL, SQL server, SSIS, SFTP (high data quality, safe storage and data accessibility)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Further we are also working in analyzing, surveillance and much more (MatLab, Python, Splunk etc.)\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In this position we will mainly focus on Frontend development, but any combination can be possible.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Completes budget planning, financial planning, actual-versus-plan-analysis, benchmarking, forecasting and reporting activities, for the management of an assigned organization unit.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   * Supports accountable management in planning and calculating yearly budgets. * Consolidate budgets, including top-down and bottom-up plans, and proceeds with revolving midterm plannings, and periodic forecasts during the year. * Performs comparisons Actual vs. Plan, and pursues effects of agreed measures. * Analyzes and evaluates cost structures, and builds, maintains and improves the depending cost accounting system. * Provides regular business reports, with respect to overall performance, and recommends actions to accountable management. * Carries out ad-hoc analyses and profitability calculations. * Contributes to conceptual and project work related to controlling. * May perform evaluations of assets and liabilities, and manages inventory measures on a regular term.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Governance for Cost allocation and Intercompany charging of Global Mobility cost<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Define Rules for <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Designs and develops product test procedures, methods and models. Trails test procedures and may execute complex tests.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A validation engineer with experience in validation tasks mainly related to electrical components.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Experience in specification and analysis of product functional requirements and electrical test design in electrical systems (generator, power converter, MV switch-gears, transformers, electrical control cabinets) and control systems (control strategies, etc.).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Main responsibilities include but are not limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Defining validation and certification strategies inside the electrical module<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To ensure that the validity of all design criteria and hypothesis has been demonstrated by means of previous product experience or tests.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Definition, execution and follow-up of the product Validation Plan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To ensure the supply of all prototypes, test instrumentation, test tooling and auxiliary equipment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To ensure the availability of test facilities (bench, site). In case of using test sites belonging to clients, to ensure fulfilment contract’s liabilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of Test Requirements Notes (TRN) released to cover the test needs: allocation and follow-up of execution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To ensure that the test configuration is representative (as for certification and validation purposes)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of events taken place during the test execution. Management of inspections required during tests.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To check, confirm and demonstrate the compliance with the validation requirements. To plan the release of the compliance Reports so to comply with the project milestones and objectives.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> More than 5-year experience as validation engineer related to electrical projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Teamwork, leadership, cross-functional communication, methodical, decisive, flexible, and proactive person.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication skills with a strong command of English, both written and verbal<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Negotiating, mainly with internal stakeholders\u002Ffunctions. Conflicts solving.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Task management, prioritization<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Germany and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Consolidate budgets, including top-down and bottom-up plans, and proceeds with revolving midterm plannings, and periodic forecasts during the year.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs comparisons Actual vs. Plan, and pursues effects of agreed measures. Analyzes and evaluates cost structures, and builds, maintains and improves the depending cost accounting system.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provides regular business reports, with respect to overall performance, and recommends actions to accountable management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carries out ad-hoc analyses and profitability calculations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contributes to conceptual and project work related to controlling.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> May perform evaluations of assets and liabilities, and manages inventory measures on a regular term.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> We are looking for a LCOE Program Manager that will be responsible for driving SGRE’s Levelized Cost of Energy optimization for selected platforms and markets. This position is framed in the recently launched LCOE program which aims at increasing SGRE’s competitiveness and profitability through a thorough and focused approach on enhanced customer value and best Levelized Cost of Energy of our combined Onshore and Service offering.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are now looking for a LCOE Program Manager that will be responsible for driving SGRE’s Levelized Cost of Energy optimization for selected platforms and markets. This position is framed in the recently launched LCOE program which aims at increasing SGRE’s competitiveness and profitability through a thorough and focused approach on enhanced customer value and best Levelized Cost of Energy of our combined Onshore and Service offering.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are a new, strong team eager to make a change and to do so we are looking for the best internal talents to join us.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a LCOE Program Manager you will be responsible for the following scope:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will act as a central manager and focal point for selected cross-functional workstreams within SGRE’s LCOE program and you will be providing expertise, guidance and direction – driving those workstreams to sustainable impact in LCOE optimization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will ensure that identified improvements are captured, evaluated and transformed into ready-to-implement measures. This includes ensuring consistency across all workstreams within the LCOE program in best practices, governance and tracking.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will report LCOE development to Onshore and Service top management on regular basis. You will drive decision making with the top leaders across both Business Units on prioritization of LCOE improvement initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will create an environment where we capture new ideas that will improve our competitiveness including but not limited to workshops and product conventions across functions and Business Units.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will ensure that the efforts of the selected cross-functional workstream teams are aligned and all the workstreams are working towards one common goal of improving SGRE’s competitiveness and reducing Levelized Cost of Energy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will help develop the necessary processes and tools that will govern SGRE’s approach towards LCOE improvement for the next years.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and drive to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> We are looking for candidates with a Technical or Business Administration degree and 2-5 years of experience in the Renewable Energy industry, preferably in cost-out or value-up activities or internal project management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will be working with an international cross-functional, cross-BU team so international and multicultural experience will be considered a benefit for this position.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You should be a team player with a passion for continuous improvement, with good people management skills and ability to motivate and engage colleagues to follow your example.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As the working language in Siemens Gamesa is English, we expect you to be fluent in both spoken and written English.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good IT skills, especially in Excel. Knowledge of reporting tools such a Power BI and programming skills will be considered a plus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will manage a construction project engineering team within the Real Estate construction department of Siemens Gamesa\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>You will be responsible for supporting several major design and construction projects globally by providing expertise in the fields of expertise shown below.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>You will manage a team of experts with the following expertise fields<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   1.Design of factories and cost optimization\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Reviewing, challenging, optimizing requirement specifications from the business in order to optimize costs (CAPEX and OPEX)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure quality of specifications signed off by the business before start of design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Propose optimized and innovative factory designs, including: modular, prefabricated, standardized, short lifetime, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Challenge and validate technical design from external architects and designers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure lessons learned and knowledge transfer cross-projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure consistency and quality of cost estimates provided to the business for early stage investigations. Ensure robust cost database is maintained.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   2.Contract and claim management support to the projects:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> During tender phase for contract draft and contract negotiation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> During project execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> At project final closing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project Management Office (PMO), operational excellence<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote a project execution excellence strategy, ensure its follow-up in the projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Control the projects in terms of quality gates and milestones<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   3.PMO support to the projects\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will thereby contribute to facilitate project execution in accordance with timeline, costs, risks, safety and quality.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will interact with many internal stakeholders and several subcontractors for all projects: designer, project management company, general contractor or built-to-suit developer.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will frequently travel to the projects locations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You have a master\u002Fdiploma in construction engineering, civil engineering, MEP engineering, architecture or similar.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have at least 7 years of work experience in project management in the context of construction projects of industrial facilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a strong understanding of the main CAPEX drivers in the design and construction of industrial facilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in manufacturing or the wind turbine business is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a strong experience in construction contract management, for example Fidic red and\u002For yellow book or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are structured, target-driven, and work solution-oriented and problem-solving manner, in order to deliver projects on time, quality and budget.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are used to work in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Project), ideally Autocad.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are very fluent (verbally and written) in English, e.g. able to negotiate and review contacts in English. Another language (e.g. Spanish or German) is a plus.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You show great leadership, strong communication and cooperation skills in a complex and diverse project environment.<\u002Fli>\n other team members.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assist in regard to managing of the contractual relationship between the contract parties and in resolving contractual issues in a proactive manner before and\u002For when they occur.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analyze the contract to raise awareness of notification requirements and to allow the responsible team members to efficiently coordinate interfaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor the execution of the contract with the aim of identifying risks and opportunities for potential claims.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform Contract and Claim Strategy Workshops.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare, update and coordinate the claim strategy for each project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare, collect, document and coordinate the sent out of all documents related to a certain claim.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the Project Team in notifying, assessing, asserting\u002Fdefending, negotiating and monitoring identified claims e.g. by preparing notifications and claim letters.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the legal department in case of Dispute Resolution and arbitration \u002F court proceedings.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You have successfully completed a university degree, ideally in business law, law or business.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience in a comparable function and have experience in negotiating claims.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Expertise in international contract law and negotiation techniques are part of your profile.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in sales and project management as well a knowledge of the wind market, its customers and competitors would be highly appreciated.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Very good know-how and experience in risk management as well as intercultural experience complete your profile<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your knowledge of English and Spanish is business fluent.<\u002Fli>\n At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Cybersecurity Engineer\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization. Read more about your future team and employees' stories in our brochure.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Across SiemensGamesa our customers are relying on cybersecurity as a key enabler to deliver modern, secure and maintainable OT solutions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a “Cybersecurity Engineer” within the Offshore Technology business unit you will deploy your cybersecurity expert knowledge across the Power Plant Control team to provide agile, responsive cybersecurity support through a diversity of projects and products, to meet both current and future customer needs.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Power Plant Control department consists of 31 devoted engineers\u002Fsoftware developers across Brande, Madrid and Bangalore. We develop control systems for renewable power plants, integrating control of wind turbines, batteries for energy storage and solar installations. The Power Plant Control system act as the electrical interface between the renewable Power Plant and grid operator in order to insure a stable and balanced electrical grid.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your responsibilities will cover:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be the anchor point of bringing your cybersecurity skills to bear across a wide array of projects and in various stages of the project lifecycle - from proposal to maintenance. Security engineering, security architecture, vulnerability assessments, penetration testing as well as embedded cybersecurity are all countermeasures that you will be dealing with in close collaboration with other Software engineering teams.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Your Working Tasks:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Integrating Customer Security Requirements in the products<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identifying vulnerabilities in existing systems\u002Fproducts and assist with eliminating\u002Freducing their impact<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Designing and implementing Security Controls and integration into the products\u002Fsystems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assisting our development teams to follow secure product development lifecycle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assisting product management in early gate activities including technology road mapping<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Response on day-to-day requests as the security subject matter expert<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for you, who wants to make real what matters and who wants to change the world to renewable energy.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The ideal candidate holds an academic degree in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science with Cybersecurity as specialization or similar in combination with thorough practical experience with in:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You are a subject matter expert in various information security disciplines like cryptographs and design-based security solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You possess a high understanding of systems engineering, architecture, development, design principles and experience in embedded, large software systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are used to produce system specifications and can carry through the technical solution according to these specifications, from the initial idea until end-of-life of the product<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Software development based c# .net ,(c++)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> TypeScript \u002F Angular IO \u002F REST service based applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> JavaScript \u002F Angular JS \u002F c#.net REST service \u002FSyncfusion \u002F Angular Material \u002F GoJS<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Automated test tools like Cypress<\u002Fli>\n  <li> NERC-CIP\u002FIEC64…<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You thrive in an environment with independent and responsibility for a technical part of a development project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> English – fluent (both oral and written) B2 to C1<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Solid understanding of development environments and technology stacks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 5-8 years of Experience<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   Most importantly, you challenge yourself and your colleagues to achieve the best results. You have a high professional competency and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration skills and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to meet the challenges with the energy of tomorrow and leave a green footprint – join the team to create a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they are in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us a global team, with the safety of our colleagues as an essential part of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a Firmware Design Engineer for our wind, solar and energy storage converters with good expertise in embedded designs.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will become part of a high-performance team responsible for the converter control firmware design for the renewable energy market.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> FW implementation in C language for power electronics converter control modules: control algorithms, communications, monitoring, alarms and so on.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Low level firmware implantation for peripherals like I2C, SPI, CAN or ADC.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analyze the requirements documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Write detailed specification, requirements, and firmware design documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Verification of the changes implemented in the firmware.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SW versions management using a version control tool.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in converter validation to ensure compliance with the design requirements in cooperation with the whole converter design team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to the quality process through the execution of test procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cooperates with other engineering teams to support product testing and certifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cooperates with other teams in the company to support presales, commissioning, aftersales, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> This position may require occasionally travel to location of the testing facilities and prototypes sites.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense of the importance of leading change. We are also looking...\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Deep knowledge of embedded systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> At least 3 years of experience in embedded firmware developments using C language.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in firmware design for DSPs and microcontrollers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Real Time Operating Systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Control engineering basics (PIDs, frequency analysis, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Electronic Instrumentation (oscilloscopes, multimeters, Signal Generators).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Digital hardware design basics (understanding of electrical diagrams).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of digital signal processing.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in analysis, diagnosis and problem solving on complex systems and its commissioning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent in Spanish and English<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SW tools: Source Code Control (GITLAB)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> VHDL Programming<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Basic knowledge of power electronic converters and electrical machines (nice to have).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Methodical and practical approach in solving problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Autonomy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective communication with co-workers and customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Critical and logical thinking<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front lines of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions, the biggest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Applicants with severe disabilities are encouraged to contact us.
