<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Indirect Materials Procurement department under the Real Estate Category, we are looking for a Global Senior Buyer. Being part of the team of Indirect Materials Procurement Operations Department, integrated in the Corporate Procurement Area and giving service to the Real Estate Category, in order to ensure the effective and optimal sourcing of the different product and services, for the commodities and vendors assigned, and required by the operating areas of SGRE global organization in collaboration with the Regional IM Procurement teams.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The main commodities included in the Real Estate scope and which you will be handling as a Global Real Estate Senior Buyer are: Cleaning, Catering, Security, Maintenance, Utilities (Electricity, Gas,...), Waste Management and any other equipment \u002F services which might be subcontracted.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For all of them, and for all different vendors assigned to the buyer, you will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Tender processes management (RFQs, E-Auctions, Negotiation and Awarding Proposals)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote cost reduction actions based on the targets set for required services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Execute procurement strategies to ensure the best market trends for the commodities included in the scope in terms of health and safety, performance, quality and cost<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sourcing - look for new potential subcontractors for the countries and services included in the scope. Market research<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Represent SGRE in meetings with suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Propose and Apply improvement proposals for the area management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate and support the regional Procurement teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate with the Legal Department in negotiating contracts with suppliers, in coordination with other internal departments (HSEQ, Field Operations, Finance, etc.). Supplier documentation control<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate on cross functional projects of processes improvement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor the subcontractors of the assigned commodities and evaluate the satisfaction of external and internal users<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report to the IM Procurement Management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support in any other activities linked to the Capex Plants procurement function<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> You have &gt;5 years of experience within Procurement and &gt;5 years of experience with sourcing or managing Real Estate - Facility Management services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> BA\u002FBS in Business Management, Procurement or Finance preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience in sourcing activities, tender preparation and execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have experience in supplier implementation and management;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You must be able to negotiate legal contracts, framework agreements and conduct business term and price negotiations utilizing various types of advanced negotiation concepts, including e-bidding and e-auctions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a strong analytical ability and process orientation skills in order to handle in a quick and effortless way large amounts of data from multiple sources, perform detailed analysis, be able to create and understand formulas &amp; pivot tables, make decisions with scant data, and perform within Microsoft Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You possess excellent time management skills; ability to work with minimal supervision;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have a results driven personality and advanced interpersonal and communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You are an expert user of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and ERP systems. Experience with Ariba Sourcing, Ariba Contract Workspace, Ariba Guided Buying will be valued<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You speak and write English and Spanish on a high level<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Severely disabled applicants are encouraged to reach out to us. We have inclusive recruiting processes specifically for severely disabled persons in Germany and we do our utmost to tailor working spaces to suit your individual needs. In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Employment at Siemens Gamesa is based solely on an individual's merit and qualifications, which are directly related to job competence. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Mission:<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As part of SGRE IT CYB team, the Software Cybersecurity Architect will develop and lead efforts to ensure that SGRE IT Software development teams operated in accordance with company Cybersecurity Policies, Standards and Baselines.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> The Software Architect will work close together with different stakeholders from IT infrastructure and Business to ensure that new developments are designed, built and maintained with required security controls in place throughout the whole development lifecycle.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i><br> Dimensions:<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Member of IT Cybersecurity group (IT CYB), will report to a Cybersecurity Manager\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Contacts:<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> IT<\u002Fli>\n  <li> OT<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Business Units<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Risk<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Internal Control<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Legal&amp; Compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Internal Audit<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Tasks:<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Participate in application and infrastructure projects to provide software development security advice.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop security strategy plans and roadmaps based on sound enterprise architecture practices.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Devise, maintain, promote and foster security Standards &amp; Baselines across the organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Stay vigilant of new security solutions and protection strategies and provide practical advice on why, when, where and how to adopt those.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assess and manage potential cybersecurity exceptions by suggesting practical workarounds and ensuring follow-up until closure.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Define Key Relevant Indicators to measure the security posture, devise cybersecurity dashboards to spot &amp; track cybersecurity weaknesses.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in close collaboration with a team of Cybersecurity Architects to analyze, assess &amp; devise end-to-end cybersecurity controls for new and existent applications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Seamless collaboration with other IT CYB areas like Governance, Risk &amp; Compliance and Cybersecurity Operations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Become a subject matter expert on IT Software Development Security in the organization.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Competencies:<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Knowledge of IT Secure Software development lifecycle and applicability of secure coding best practices, tools and procedures throughout it.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of cybersecurity principles, including risk assessment and management, threat and vulnerability management, incident response, and identity and access management. In-depth experience in i cybersecurity management processes and tools.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Documented experience and a strong working knowledge of the methodologies to conduct threat-modeling exercises and project support on new applications and services.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in using architecture methodologies such as SABSA, Zachman and\u002For TOGAF<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong knowledge and experience in translating Cybersecurity Standards such as ISO 27001,SANS CIS TOP 20 controls or NIST into real and achievable IT technical controls and processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cross understanding of IT application map, general processes (ITIL), their relations and interfaces with business areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with the IT organization, project and application development teams, management and business personnel; in-depth knowledge and understanding of information risk concepts and principles as a means of relating business needs to security controls; an excellent understanding of information security concepts, protocols, industry best practices and strategies.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Assurance, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field of study.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A minimum of five years of practical experience in a cybersecurity role and at least two of them on a similar position as requested.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proven experience in the following domains: Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC) management, cloud security, network security, identity management &amp; governance, privileged access management, data security.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong knowledge &amp; understanding of ITIL processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Language skills: English fluent – C1 (spoken, written) and Spanish as a minimum.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally, Proven experience on DevSecOps environments and IaC (Infrastructure as Code).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally, Cybersecurity certifications like CISSP, CISA, CISM or SANS’s GIAC.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally, Certified DevSecOps Professional (CDP) or Certified Secure Sofware Lifecycle Professional (CSSLP).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally, Microsoft certifications on Azure DevSecOps.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong multi-project management, time management and organizational skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of proposing practical solutions to complex problems and come to agreements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to work with a high degree of independence.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to build strong relationships with people at all levels of the organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to foster inclusiveness and participation from all team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to develop the cybersecurity posture of the organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong interpersonal, communication, consultative, and people management skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to prioritize and succeed on multiple assignments simultaneously, in a fast-paced and highly challenging environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to effectively work with customers and management personnel on all levels, business areas and across cultures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent negotiation skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Self-determination, team player and decision-making skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Multicultural work environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Unquestionable integrity, objectivity, and independence.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Driven license and own vehicle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Location in Zamudio or Pamplona (Hybrid remote working possible)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Open to international travel<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment, we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n In cases of severe disability, applicants who are equally qualified will be given preferential consideration.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a work environment that is free from discrimination and where employees are treated with dignity and respect. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a power converter component engineer for our wind, solar and energy storage converters with good expertise in power electronics hardware design. You will become part of a high-performance team responsible for the converter hardware design for the renewable energy market.\n  <br> \n  <br> Tasks:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Deep knowledge of power electronics topologies and components.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review requirements, standards, and other documentation to clarify and understand converter hardware requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Converter modeling (PSIM or Matlab) with the focus on the component design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical specification of custom components: heatsinks (air and water-cooled), busbars, capacitors, semiconductors (IGBTs mainly), protections, AC filters, power cabling, cooling system, etc<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thermal analysis of the converter (cooling concept and thermal modeling support)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Customization analysis to local requirements and designs\u002Fadapts products and solutions accordingly.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support double sourcing program.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Propose technical findings and developments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Writes detailed specifications and design documents of all the converter main components.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in converter validation to ensure compliance with the design requirements in cooperation with the whole converter design team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to the quality process through the execution of test procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cooperates with other engineering teams to support product testing and certifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cooperates with other teams in the company to support presales, commissioning, aftersales, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> This position may require travel to customer and non-customer sites (&lt;=20%)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> This position requires presential participation on validation processes on Madrid testbenches<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Skills and experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> University degree in electrical\u002Felectronics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> At least 3 years of experience in power electronics converter design (preferably high power, i.e. &gt;100 kW)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in analysis, diagnosis and problem solving on complex systems and its commissioning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent in Spanish and English<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SW tools: Matlab and\u002For PSIM<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other valuable skills:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Methodical and practical approach in solving problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Autonomy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> As Agile Enterprise Coach, member of our Lean-Agile Center of Excellence and SAFe® Program Consultant (SPC) you will promote, coach &amp; guide the mindset, principles and practices of lean-agile ways of working in our organization to optimize business performance and agility\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Agile Enterprise Coach and member of our Lean-Agile Center of Excellence with extensive knowledge of Lean-Agile development principles and practices including the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe®), you will as Certified SAFe® Program Consultant (SPC) lead, guide, advice, train, coach, and mentor others at SGRE on how to apply SAFe (Lean-Agile methods, DevOps, and Systems Thinking) to improve the way we design, build, test, and deploy products, systems &amp; solutions to the market. In this role you will:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead operational excellence in SGRE units using Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe®) by focusing on relentless improvement and continually improving efficiency, practices, and results to optimize business performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicate and promote the organization’s vision to adopt Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe®); be certified and qualified to teach SAFe® courses to others at SGRE. Facilitate Value Stream Identification Workshops &amp; help define and optimize Agile Release Trains (ARTs)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare teams and “teams of teams” made up of engineers, leaders, and business stakeholders to put into practice their newly acquired skills as they launch Agile Release Trains (ARTs).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Host workshops, facilitate discussions, help Agile teams and Agile Release Trains to plan incrementally, iterate and execute their plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Actively listen to engineers and leaders during training courses, workshops, and consultations to understand their challenges and offer suggestions to help them understand how to improve SGRE’s Business Agility.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in important SAFe® events like Program Increment (PI) Planning and Inspect &amp; Adapt (I&amp;A). Teach, coach, mentor while modeling to others the principles and practices of SAFe®.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Become an active member of the SGRE Lean-Agile Center of Excellence (LACE) working to successfully continue our journey to transform our organization using SAFe®.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify opportunities and suggest innovative ways to automate portions of our delivery pipeline increasing productivity and quality while shortening time to market. Analyze business processes with respect to standardization, simplification, integration and discontinuance.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A motivating team player, who is resilient, responsible, and structured with excellent communication skills to interact with stakeholders high and low in the organization as well as external stakeholders. You are motivated by providing quality results within the deadline and are not frightened of working in an ever-changing organization and environment. Furthermore, you have an analytical mindset, exceptional coordination skills, commercial understanding, solid technical competencies, strong cross-functional leadership and thrive in a dynamic environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Furthermore, we expect you to have a master’s degree in software engineering, computer science, data science electrical engineering or related fields and have several years’ engineering experience with demonstrated technical and professional skills in Systems Engineering or Agile Software Development. You are experienced and qualified in SAFe® and ideally already a Certified SAFe® Program Consultant, qualified and experienced in teaching SAFe® courses.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We expect that you are proficient at analyzing unusual and complex issues while driving for results in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment and have highly developed and demonstrated communication skills, oral and written, to collaborate effectively across the organization and thrive in a dynamic, intercultural environment distributed across several countries.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You have strong interpersonal skills including actively listening, leading people, coaching, consulting, and resolving conflicts with people. You are a bold, passionate, proactive innovator who has or is willing to participate with others leading SGRE through the transformation to SAFe®.You have strong management skills to lead, plan, prioritize, and execute work in efficient and effective ways to meet or exceed objectives on time with quality.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You possess excellent English language skills both orally and in writing. Danish, German and\u002For Spanish language skills would be helpful.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> If you have specific questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> For our Data Warehousing team, we are looking for an experienced cloud data engineer to join us in developing the next generation IoT platform. We are working in a hybrid cloud environment and responsible for data integration, storage, provisioning, analytics, and data lifecycle management.\n <div>\n   As our industry has moved to large-scale power plants there is a high focus on cyber security while the ever-increasing data volumes require careful considerations for compression in data streams and storage under constrains of cost and performance.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a senior cloud developer in our modern data warehouse and datalake ecosystem you will be responsible for both development and operation of SQL databases, data storage\u002Fdata-lake and data\u002FETL pipelines in a hybrid cloud environment. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   SiemensGamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. SiemensGamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Digital Foundation &amp; Infrastructure team within the Software Solutions department, we are looking for a skilled and dedicated a Solution Architect with an excellent knowledge of modern technologies to define, design and implement a modern edge infrastructure for wind farms globally. You have a broad knowledge about classic IT infrastructure based on VMware, Windows, Linux and Cisco networking to be able to comprehend the current environment and envision how it seamlessly can be transformed into a future low maintenance, highly scalable and state-of-the-art secure edge computing environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The job responsibility evolves around defining, designing, building and implementing DevOps solutions to ensure smooth IT operations. As Solution Architect, you will be managing our Cybersecurity system designs. Your primary tasks are to design new solutions in close collaboration with our Solution Managers and Enterprise Architects, to find the best possible support processes and architecture for our digital solutions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be responsible, together with your skilled colleagues in your team, to define and design the lower part of the stack, including hardware and OS for cloud native applications. You will work closely with a team of highly skilled networking engineers to introduce new network solutions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will, together with colleagues in your team, have the responsibility to define test plans and test cases, cooperate with System Integration to build automated test environments, so that not only the applications layer, but the whole stack is tested as a complete system for every release as a part of SGREs continuous integration workflow.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for you, who wants to make real what matters and who wants to change to world to renewable energy.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The ideal candidate holds an academic degree within Computer Science, IT, SW Engineering or similar in combination with 3+ years of experience with IT architecture and thorough practical experience with:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Designing and implementing secure SCADA systems\u002Finfrastructures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Automatic deployment of new solutions in a DevOps environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Combining software solution design and the underlying infrastructure to support it<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Define test plans and test cases carried out in automated test environments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent in English - C1<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Tools: Must have: Agile; SAFE; Linux; Windows; VMware; Kubernetes;<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Most importantly, you understand how to design secure solutions on both software and infrastructure level, and can communicate needs between corporate and technical staff. You have a high professional competency and you have a desire to develop your skills. You have good collaboration skills and you can manage to act in different cultural contexts. To thrive in this position, you must have a strong result- and customer-oriented approach.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsidized lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> #Mid-senior<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other information\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact recruiting team via Nicki Møller on \n  <div>\n   nicki.moller.ext@siemensgamesa.com\n  <\u002Fdiv>. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Working as part of our Infrastructure Portfolio team, we are looking for an experienced Managed Network Services Owner professional who can play an integral role in utilising the latest network strategies and tools to ensure we have an effectve network architecture landscape.\n <br> \n <br> The role will be responsible for Managed Network Services entailing the Strategy, Supplier Management, and a broad range of service management and operations (including service element management, service catalog maintenance, service management framework and possible escalations) to ensure that given IT services or solutions are available to the business.\n <br> \n <br> You will work with service partners to understand their mission, envision how your products and services evolve to meet that mission and help balance various interests. You understand trade-offs are often necessary and use transparency to gain and maintain trust, providing a clear purpose and direction and respect how you remain aware of the technical realities of your domain.\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Identifies IT service or solution related business goals, objectives and needs of the business environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Implements process standards and policies and is responsible for their consistent execution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oversees IT service or solution related performance and delivery indicators.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> May optimize IT service management frameworks for multi-vendor environments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contributes and supports planning, budgeting, design and alignment of service management processes and IT solutions landscapes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advices business accountable management of the unit, in all IT Service &amp; Solution Management related issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports customization and the specification of service elements throughout the entire service lifecycle.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contributes to the maintenance of all service catalog items and the provisioning of an integrated catalog of infrastructure services.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate relevant unit and integration tests, and communicates with vendors and service providers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manages complex infrastructure solution\u002Fservice installations or updates.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports or manages change-release processes and implementation of IT security guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identifies IT service or solution problems and seeks resolutions without impact to end user.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribute to the management of issues through escalation process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribute to the implementation of knowledge management standards by gathering, analyzing, sorting and sharing relevant information.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Keeps abreast of developments in industry regarding IT Technology &amp; Service and Solution Management<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are looking for a Service Owner who will work collaboratively with other teams and key stakeholders and will be responsible for:-\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Owning the demand portfolio, product strategy and roadmap pipeline and schedule, collaborating with architects, engineers, live operations, business engagement and other teams to ensure evolving business needs are continuously met<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 5 + years’ experience in a MNS role<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience Covering SDWAN, LAN\u002FWLAN, Zscaler, paloalto, Crowdstrike, Checkpoint, Mobile technologies and MS Azure (network components), AWS and Google cloud services.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identifying user requirements through user experience to inform features and products and procurement activity<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Form part of a cross-functional team from a product's conception all the way through to its launch and ongoing support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitoring performance of your product line working with architects and engineers to identify continuous service improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working with internal teams and suppliers to identify resolutions to incidents and problem tickets and utilise this data to improve the service of a product<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Developing strong relationships with a range of stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis of large and complex data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Requirements analysis, strategy, design, implementation, and migration for businesses<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of proficiency.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Skills\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Power converter component engineer for multimegawatt wind applications\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a power converter component engineer for our wind, solar and energy storage converters with good expertise in power electronics hardware design. You will become part of a high-performance team responsible for the converter hardware design for the renewable energy market.\n  <br> \n  <br> Tasks:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Deep knowledge of power electronics topologies and components.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review requirements, standards, and other documentation to clarify and understand converter hardware requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Converter modeling (PSIM or Matlab) with the focus on the component design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical specification of custom components: heatsinks (air and water-cooled), busbars, capacitors, semiconductors (IGBTs mainly), protections, AC filters, power cabling, cooling system, etc<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thermal analysis of the converter (cooling concept and thermal modeling support)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Customization analysis to local requirements and designs\u002Fadapts products and solutions accordingly.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support double sourcing program.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Propose technical findings and developments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Writes detailed specifications and design documents of all the converter main components.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participates in converter validation to ensure compliance with the design requirements in cooperation with the whole converter design team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to the quality process through the execution of test procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cooperates with other engineering teams to support product testing and certifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cooperates with other teams in the company to support presales, commissioning, aftersales, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Other requirements:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>This position may require travel to customer and non-customer sites (&lt;=20%)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>This position requires presential participation on validation processes on Madrid testbenches<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What you need to make a difference\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Skills and experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>University degree in electrical\u002Felectronics<\u002Fli>\n  <li>At least 3 years of experience in power electronics converter design (preferably high power, i.e. &gt;100 kW)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience in analysis, diagnosis and problem solving on complex systems and its commissioning<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Fluent in Spanish and English<\u002Fli>\n  <li>SW tools: Matlab and\u002For PSIM<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   Other valuable skills:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Methodical and practical approach in solving problems<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Autonomy<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Effective communication with co-workers and customers<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Team work<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Critical and logical thinking<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you…\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible working hours as well as home-office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive remuneration package<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more<\u002Fli>\n
